content.question: Which of the following correctly justifies why the motion can be called simple harmonic motion?

choices.label: The torque is directly proportional to the sine of the angle that the pendulum makes with the vertical, regardless of how large the angle is.
The pendulum is released at a small angle, so the torque is directly proportional to the angle that the pendulum makes with the vertical.
The torque is directly proportional to how far the end of the pendulum is from its equilibrium position, regardless of how far from equilibrium it is.
The torque is directly proportional to the length of the pendulum.

content.answer: The pendulum is released at a small angle, so the torque is directly proportional to the angle that the pendulum makes with the vertical.
